title: Creating an Equation
text: The small angles of a right triangle add to $$90$$. $$x+y=90$$. From the problem, we also know that $$x-3y=26$$.
speech: The small angles of a right triangle add to  90 .  x, plus y, is equal to, 90 . From the problem, we also know that  x, minus 3 y is equal to 26 .
pacedSpeech: The small angles of a right triangle add to   90
.   x, plus y, is equal to, 90
. From the problem, we also know that   x, minus 3 y is equal to 26

title: Elimination
text: We can multiply the first equation by $$3$$ to get $$3x+3y=270$$. Now, we add the equations to eliminate $$y$$. $$4x=296$$
speech: We can multiply the first equation by  3  to get  3 x, plus 3 y is equal to, 270 . Now, we add the equations to eliminate  y .  4 x is equal to 296

to get   3 x, plus 3 y is equal to, 270

title: Solving for X, Y
text: $$x=\frac{296}{4}=74$$. Plugging $$x$$ back into the equation, we get $$y=90-74=16$$.
speech: x is equal to 296 over 4, is equal to, 74 . Plugging  x  back into the equation, we get  y is equal to 90 minus 74, is equal to 16 .
